snippet: Only a few hundred people showed up to support Leopoldo López, a day after he was convicted and sentenced to nearly 14 years in prison.
abstract: Turnout is poor for rally in support of Venezuelan opposition leader Leopoldo Lopez following his conviction on charges of inciting violence in connection with 2014 public demonstrations; Lopez is sentenced to nearly 14 years in military prison; small size of crowd underscores how discouraged opposition movement has become, even as it continues to espouse hope for victory in December's crucial legislative elections.

byline.contributor: Patricia Torres and María Eugenia Díaz contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Only a few hundred people showed up to support Leopoldo López, a day after he was convicted and sentenced to nearly 14 years in prison.

headline.main: Opposition in Venezuela Is Unsettled by Leader’s Sentence
headline.print_headline: Opposition in Venezuela Is Unsettled by Leader’s Sentence
